title: The Essex Serpent lengths of white cloth

content.question: Toward the middle of the second paragraph, the comparison between the stars and “a distant cloud of fireflies” (sentence 6) is best described as

choices.label: a homely simile that expresses the narrator’s yearning for a more rural setting
a reductive image that reveals the extent to which the narrator’s moral values have been corrupted by the city
a hyperbolic expression that hints at the stars’ destructive potential
a lively metaphor that emphasizes the narrator’s initial delight at being able to see stars in the city

content.answer: a lively metaphor that emphasizes the narrator’s initial delight at being able to see stars in the city

skill.text: Skill 5.D: Identify and explain the function of an image or imagery.
